00003 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00004 #define _USE_MATH_DEFINES
00005 #endif

00007 #include <iostream>

00010 #include <cmath>

00012 using namespace std;

00014 namespace DFLib

00016   void DFLib::Abstract::Report::computeFixCut(DFLib::Abstract::Report *Report2, 
00017                                               Point &returnPoint,
00018                                               double &cutAngle,
00019                                               FixStatus &fs)
00020   {
00021     vector<double> p2,p2p;
00022     vector<double> rp;
00023     double theta2;
00024     double thetaprime;
00025     double phi;
00026     double DEG_TO_RAD=M_PI/180.0;
00027 
00028 
00029     // translate myself to origin, drag Report2 along for ride:
00030     p2p=Report2->getReceiverLocation();
00031 
00032     p2p[0] -= getReceiverLocation()[0];
00033     p2p[1] -= getReceiverLocation()[1];
00034 
00035     // Thetas are always in 0<theta<2PI for the arithmetic to work:
00036     thetaprime  = getReportBearingRadians();
00037     theta2  = Report2->getReportBearingRadians();
00038 
00039     // Now rotate counter clockwise about the origin by thetaprime
00040     p2.resize(2);
00041     p2[0] = p2p[0]*cos(thetaprime)-p2p[1]*sin(thetaprime);
00042     p2[1] = p2p[1]*cos(thetaprime)+p2p[0]*sin(thetaprime);
00043     theta2 -= thetaprime;
00044     // convert theta2 to -PI<theta2<PI so our tests below work
00045     while (theta2 > M_PI)
00046       theta2 -= 2*M_PI;
00047 
00048     while (theta2 < -M_PI)
00049       theta2 += 2*M_PI;
00050 
00051     cutAngle = fabs(theta2);
00052 
00053     // if his point is in left half-plane, reflect around y axis  
00054     if (p2[0]<0)
00055     {
00056       p2[0] *= -1;
00057       theta2 *= -1;
00058     }
00059 
00060     rp.resize(2);
00061     rp[0]=rp[1]=0.0;
00062 
00063     // Special cases.  We treat degenerate fixes as "no fix" for now.
00064 
00065     if (p2[0] == 0 && p2[1] == 0    // he and I are in same spot!
00066         || p2[0] ==0             // he is on my beam or back beam (degenerate)
00067         || fabs(theta2) < 1e-6          // our beams are parallel, no fix
00068         || fabs(fabs(theta2)-M_PI)<1e-6) // parallel, opp direction
00069     {
00070       fs=DFLib::NO_FIX;
00071     }
00072     else
00073     {
00074       // Compute angle that line from me to him makes with X axis:
00075       phi = atan2(p2[1],p2[0]);
00076             
00077       // now we have my bearing as y axis, me at origin, 
00078       // his bearing and his position in appropriate half-plane.
00079       // The fix, if there is one, will be on positive Y axis.
00080             
00081       if ( theta2 > 0 || (theta2 <= -(phi+M_PI/2.0)))
00082         // his bearing points away from Y axis, or points at negative Y
00083         // (treat degenerate case where he points right
00084         // along bearing to me as no fix, too)
00085       {
00086         fs=DFLib::NO_FIX;
00087       } 
00088       else // his beam intersects positive y axis, we have a fix!
00089       {
00090         double xfp,yfp;
00091         // theta2 is negative, M_PI/2+theta2 is positive angle between 
00092         // horizontal and beam
00093         rp[1]=p2[1]+p2[0]*tan(M_PI/2+theta2);
00094         fs=DFLib::GOOD_FIX;
00095         // now rotate clockwise by my theta:
00096         xfp = rp[0]*cos(thetaprime)+rp[1]*sin(thetaprime);
00097         yfp = rp[1]*cos(thetaprime)-rp[0]*sin(thetaprime);
00098 
00099 
00100         rp[0]=xfp+getReceiverLocation()[0]; // translate back.
00101         rp[1]=yfp+getReceiverLocation()[1];
00102       }
00103     }
00104     returnPoint.setXY(rp);
00105   }
00106 
00107   double DFLib::Abstract::Report::computeBearingToPoint(vector<double> &aPoint)
00108   {
00109     double dx=aPoint[0]-getReceiverLocation()[0];
00110     double dy=aPoint[1]-getReceiverLocation()[1];
00111     double bearingToPoint=atan2(dx , dy);
00112     while (bearingToPoint < 0)
00113       bearingToPoint += 2*M_PI;
00114     return (bearingToPoint);
00115   }
00116 
00117 }
